attributes.action: Abolish MP's Food & Drink subsidy up 20% to £6 million per annum
attributes.additional_details: A quick & easy way to save money and help with the deficit. In 2009 David Cameron said that if elected he would stop MP's subsidised alcohol & food. Nick Clegg was recently quoted as "intuitively" against the tax payer subsidies. So why are MP's still receiving this benefit. This is a very easy fix and a good saving to the taxpayer
